definition: changeable situation (idiom)
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
cloud/CL:朵[duo3]
(classical) to say
surname Yun/abbr. for Yunnan Province 雲南省|云南省[Yun2 nan2 Sheng3]
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
fantasy

sentences.english: THAILAND’S recent political history has been, to put it mildly, volatile.
sentences.chinese: 泰国近年的政治，说得婉转些，是风云变幻。

sentences.english: Today, there is no excuse for not knowing what is going on in the markets.
sentences.chinese: 如今，已经没有理由不清楚市场上的风云变幻了。

sentences.english: In the turbulent, toss-about world of work, all kinds of people are worried about getting fired.
sentences.chinese: 在风云变幻的职场中，每个人都在担心会不会被炒。

sentences.english: Jia said that the traditional friendship between both countries has withstood the tests of changeable international situations.
sentences.chinese: 贾庆林说，中越传统友谊经历了国际风云变幻的考验。

sentences.english: The political landscape was changing as quickly as a fast-moving computer game.
sentences.chinese: 政坛风云变幻之迅速如同瞬息万变的电脑游戏。

sentences.english: Different occasion on behalf of the Ming and Qing Dynasties, is a changing era.
sentences.chinese: 明清异代之际，是一个风云变幻的时代。

definition: to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
to change unpredictably/unpredictable/erratic/treacherous
great changes
lit. sinking and floating/to bob up and down on water/ebb and flow/fig. rise and fall/ups and downs of fortune/vicissitudes
in large numbers/in force/lit. clouds bubbling up
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
unrest (social or political)/turmoil/upheaval/commotion
weather/unstable situation
in an instant a myriad changes (idiom); rapid substantial change
turbulent situation/changing (face, scene, situation, world of etc)
lit. a white cloud transforms into what looks like a gray dog (idiom)/fig. the unpredictable changeability of the world
unpredictable/changeable
changes/vicissitudes
lit. fire beacons in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
lit. the blue sea turned into mulberry fields (idiom)/fig. the transformations of the world
one climax follows another (of thrilling story)
to change dramatically/radical change
